items.sentence: I don\'t know how Tom is going to keep his dog from doing that.
Tom has been eating at that restaurant since he was a teenager.
It makes sense to pay off your credit card balance every month.
Tom, your handwriting isn\'t very good, but it\'s easy to read.
The radio station came back on the air shortly after the storm.
Tom pried up the floorboards looking for the hidden gold coins.
Tom said that he wanted to move his chair closer to the window.
Tom spent all the money he had to buy Mary a Christmas present.
Tom is working as a waiter, but he\'s looking for a better job.
Tom isn\'t doing much business during these bad economic times.
Tom isn\'t the kind of person who would do something like that.
Tom knew he didn\'t have enough time to do what had to be done.
Didn\'t you tell me yesterday that you wouldn\'t be late today?
Don\'t blame yourself for what happened. It wasn\'t your fault.
Dream as if you\'ll live forever. Live as if you\'ll die today.
Tom told Mary he wasn\'t interested in helping her do anything.
Tom told me he didn\'t recognize Mary the last time he saw her.
Let\'s get together for dinner the next time you\'re in Boston.
Tom pretended he didn\'t understand what Mary wanted him to do.
Tom couldn\'t remember whether or not he\'d turned off the gas.
